output.name: Protobuf Code Generation System
output.description: A system that generates cross-language serialization code (C++, Python, Rust) from .proto files using pre-built protoc binaries, requiring no compilation or package managers.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Found author profile via search_infoscience_authors_tool with exact name match.

entity.title: Laser Scanning with Industrial Robot Arm for Raw-wood Fabrication
entity.abstract: This paper presents an integrated raw-wood fabrication workflow using an industrial robot arm and a laser scanner. The research is situated in a Swiss mountain forestry context where timber in its natural form could be applied locally without relying on large centralized timber industries.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Found in Petras Vestartas's publications via get_author_publications_tool; exact author match.

entity.title: Design-to-Fabrication Workflow for Raw-Sawn-Timber using Joinery Solver
entity.abstract: Currently, the Swiss timber industry in mountain areas largely exports unprocessed lumber and imports finished timber products due to the lack of digital tools. By using new digital design-to-production workflows, it is possible to investigate new building systems for small-scale structures using local materials.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Doctoral thesis authored by Petras Vestartas; exact name and DOI match.

entity.title: Joinery Solver for Whole Timber Structures
entity.abstract: This paper presents a digital joinery generation method for whole-timber structures using wood-wood connections. The research is based on a collaboration with a local timber company located in a mountain area.
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference paper not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Co-authored by Petras Vestartas; found via get_author_publications_tool.

entity.title: Structural design methodology in Integrally-Attached Timber Plate structures
entity.abstract: The immediate application of research discoveries requires a global and exact understanding of the structure under consideration. To gain insight into the complex behavior of structures, numerical simulations are carried out in parallel to physical experiments and digital fabrication, computer-aided...

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Chapter co-authored by Petras Vestartas, found in author publication list.

entity.title: Parametric Workshop
entity.abstract: This bi-annual workshop is an introduction to parametric design for Master 1 students following Studio Weinand. The following topics are being discussed: impact of digital technologies on the design process, fabrication and assembly constraints, collaborative workflows, geometry fundamentals, constraints etc.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Workshop material listing Petras Vestartas as co-author; found through author publications.

entity.title: Robotically-Fabricated Nexorades from Whole Timber
entity.abstract: This paper introduces the conceptual design of sustainable timber structures using raw wood. It presents a workflow for systematically generating Nexorades using a tiling method for multi-valence quad subdivided surfaces. The system is designed based on an integrated framework combining resources ...
entity.publication_type: text::conference output::conference paper not in proceedings

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Co-authored conference paper found in Petras Vestartas's publications list.

entity.title: Design framework for the structural analysis of free-form timber plate structures using wood-wood connections
entity.abstract: Geometrically complex timber plate structures using wood-wood connections are increasingly designed thanks to digital fabrication. Whereas their fabrication has been automated using computer-aided design programming, research focused on the development of automated numerical tools for their structur...

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Journal article with exact DOI match and author inclusion.

entity.title: Modelling Workflow for Segmented Timber Shells using Wood-wood Connections.
entity.abstract: This paper presents a modelling method based on planarization for double-curved segmented timber shell made from quad polygons and assembled by wood-wood connections. The inspiration is taken from timber dome structures, where solid timber walls were built from planks, connected side by side.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Conference presentation listing Petras Vestartas; retrieved via author publication query.

entity.title: Performance Assessment of Double-Layered Timber Plate Shells using Alternative Structural Systems
entity.abstract: With recent advances in digital fabrication, innovative wood-wood connections inspired by ancient timber joining techniques have recently been applied to various free-form timber plate structures [1]. This paper focuses on the recently developed double-layered and double-curved timber plate shells ...
